title: polygon mainnet out of sync
body:
#### System information

Erigon version: 2.35.1

OS & Version: Linux

Commit hash :  erigon version 2.35.0-stable-2685097d

#### run cmd
```
usr/local/bin/erigon --datadir=/node/archive/polygon-erigon/ --chain=bor-mainnet --bor.heimdall=${heimdallAddr} --db.read.concurrency=5000 --rpc.batch.concurrency=10000 --http=true --http.api 'eth,net,web3,debug,trace,txpool' --http.addr 0.0.0.0 --http.corsdomain '*' --http.vhosts '*' --ws --metrics --metrics.addr 0.0.0.0 --port=21290 --http.port 21299 --private.api.addr='' --authrpc.port 21293 --torrent.port=21294 --metrics.port 21295
```

#### sync logs


Same issue on goerli, mainnet and polygon. Metrics show very slow bodies stage. Logs looks same Erigon version: 2.35.1 OS & Version: Linux
Try the patched released v2.35.2 - it has a fix for that
@dzmitrykliapkou can you show the full log since the restart please?

> @dzmitrykliapkou can you show the full log since the restart please?

Here they are
[erigon.txt](https://github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/files/10466217/erigon.txt)

@dzmitrykliapkou thank you! Would you be able to gather stack trace for the node, for example by terminating it with `kill -6` ? I suspect that it is deadlocked somewhere. Also, could you run it with `--log.dir.verbosity 4` to see debug messages?

hi @AlexeyAkhunov
Sure, we reran node with --log.dir.verbosity 4 param and executed `kill -6` command
Sending logs:
[logs_20.01.23.txt](https://github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/files/10466821/logs_20.01.23.txt)

@slider90 this is the relevant part, where it is stuck on MDBX put for 6 minutes:

@slider90 @dzmitrykliapkou do you use docker or you build from source? I would like to make a branch where we rollback the MDBX version upgrade, to see if it works for you
Branch is `rollback-mdbx` , if you need docker build on dockerhub, I can create another one to build on docker hub
@AlexeyAkhunov we use docker. Please push docker image to dockerhub
Building now, will be available under `docker pull thorax/erigon:docker_mdbx`

@AlexeyAkhunov 
thorax/erigon:docker_mdbx image is not available. Have you pushed it?

> @AlexeyAkhunov
> thorax/erigon:docker_mdbx image is not available. Have you pushed it?

Just wait a few minutes, it will appear. We are not pushing images manually, docker hub builds it for us, for all tags, and branches starting with `docker_` and also for `devel` and `stable`
Now image is ready

Not sure how to do it from docker, but if you were to build from sources, you could try to do this to "warm up the GC":

```
make db-tools
`./build/bin/mdbx_stat -efff <datadir>/chaindata /dev/null`
```
@slider90 could you post full logs from restart for the `docker_mdbx` ?

@AlexeyAkhunov sure,
[logs_docker_mdbx.txt](https://github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/files/10469232/logs_docker_mdbx.txt)
@slider90 Thank you! Can you also do `kill -6` and show me the stack trace? I would like to confirm that it is still stuck in the same place

> @AlexeyAkhunov
> Executed `kill -6` command inside of the container and sending logs:
> [logs_docker_mdbx_with_kill.log](https://github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/files/10469365/logs_docker_mdbx_with_kill.log)

Thank you so much, this is super helpful, this evidence lets me provisionally conclude that MDBX upgrade is not a probably cause of this issue:
